data.title: HTML5 games preview gives a 404 error on Linux
data.body: HTML5 games preview gives a 404 error on Fedora 23. Seems like a permission problem.

data.title: Refactor directory structure
data.body:
@victorlevasseur I've updated the location of a fair amount of files.

The classes describing a project are in `GDCore/Project`. Events classes are in `GDCore/Events` (including the Metadata classes, CodeGeneration related classes and Builtin events). 
`GDCore/Extensions` contains the classes related to platform/extensions and builtin extensions. `GDCore/IDE` now have a few sub directories too for classes related to editing Project/Events.

The same structure is reflected in GDJS and GDCpp (Events, Project, Extensions). My goal is to have a better distinction between events (that could/should live on their own), project classes (which describe a game), the game engines (in `GDJS/Runtime` for GDJS, for GDCpp it's still in GDCpp folder but maybe one day I could move all game engine classes into GDCpp/Runtime) and the IDE classes (also everything related to wxWidgets should live at the end in `Dialogs` folders or `wxTools`). Maybe I'll also rename Dialogs to wxDialogs to emphasize the use of wxWidgets only in this folder.

I've almost only moved files, nothing should be broken. Let me know if you have any concern with these changes. :)

data.title: Storage actions in HTML5 don't work (through multiple sessions) if the file is not loaded using the "load file" action
data.body: Storage actions in HTML5 don't work (through multiple sessions, the file is lost at the end of the session) if the file is not loaded using the "load file" action.

data.title: Improve help
data.body:
- add a gd::HelpFileAccess::OpenPage method to launch the help from the wiki using the user language (if supported by the wiki, english otherwise).
- add a SetHelpPage method in gd::InstructionMetadata to set an help page for instructions. A button is shown under the instruction description to open the related help.

data.body: @victorlevasseur You may want to take a look at https://github.com/4ian/GD/commit/656b3bf3ebe15df027e8ad9e473b0330cfe64749 :) Let me know if you spot anything that looks like a mis-usage of gd::String locale/utf8 conversions.

data.title: Certain things slow to load (Music and AdMod banner)
data.body:
I have a music file that is reproduce at the beginning of the scene (Play music on a channel), the size of the file is around 1.5 MB.

I export it to Android with cordova, and build it with intel XDK, and when I install the app and run it, take more than 20 seconds to reproduce the music. Same thing happen with the Admob banner, I install third party plugin (cordova plugin Admob basic), setup it, build and install the app in the phone, but the banner NO load at once, it take sometimes more than 30 seconds to show. What can i do?

Thanks.

data.title: Error when checking for update on startup
data.body:
Hi for All!

When I startup GDevelop (version "gd4088.noinstaller"), it gives me an error:

"Can't open [temporary file]......." (attached image)

I think that this error is occurring on my system (Windows 8.1 64bits) beacuse of the line 51 on the file UpdateChecker.cpp.

It's a "harcoded" string path "/GDTemporaries/", that invalidates the windows path (that uses "\" instead of "/") on the temporary dir returned by the wxFileName::GetTempDir().

Maybe the correction shuld verify: 

separator = (system == "windows") ? "\" : "/";

Sorry, please, if I made some mistakes with the language :-)

Thank you! 

GDevelop is awesome!!!! :-)

![gdevelop-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12375516/9996953/0975c460-6060-11e5-8d9c-83816716b452.png)

data.title: Fix Vsync and Max FPS not reactived after a sf::RenderWindow change
Refactor methods of gdjs.RuntimeObject and improve PanelSpriteObject
Problem with collision and hitboxes in HTML5 games
data.body:
It seems there is a problem with custom hitboxes and the collision condition in HTML5 games.
Even if the hitboxes are taken into account, the collision is triggered before the collision between the hitboxes. I think it's related to this condition : https://github.com/4ian/GD/blob/master/GDJS/Runtime/runtimeobject.js#L1024 because the collision condition is the only one that doesn't work correctly (the separateObjects condition works perfectly with the hitboxes).

See http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?f=19&t=6968#p53037

data.title: Pathfinding bug : when destination is on the next/previous column/line (from the starting point)
data.body:
In the Pathfinding playground test that you added in the previous commit, the player can't move to the destination if the destination is on next/previous line/column. However, it works if the destination is close to him (1/2/3 cells away).

Here is an example : 
![pathfindingproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/964512/9664822/88cd93ac-526c-11e5-9cfc-4c6b7081131a.gif)

Note : if I deactivate the maximum loop counter in the pathfinding ~~automatism~~ behavior, GDevelop crash because of an infinite loop

data.title: Fix accentuated characters in ParticleEmitterObjectEditor
Support for saving project in multiple files ("Folder project")
data.body:
This implements support for saving and loading projects as "Folder project", meaning that scenesm external layouts and external events are stored into separate files. This can greatly enhance the collaboration on medium/large projects when more than one person is involved. people can keep working on levels in the external layouts for example, or on different scenes then share their files. :smile:

The implementation is done using a `Splitter` class that "cut" some part of the tree representing the whole serialized projects. The new element are containing a reference to the part that were cut (i.e: the other files). I've also moved the part writing JSON/XML files from gd::Project to a separate class (because it's not the project responsibility to manage files).

@victorlevasseur If you have some time, you can pull the branch and check if you can save a few projects as folder projects, and then load them/modify them again :)

This should be one of the last feature added before releasing version 4 (still need to make sure help is easily accessible for the new AdMob banner and do a find/replace in the wiki to replace automatism by behavior). Let me know if you have something in mind apart from these points that should be addressed/fixed before v4 :smile:

data.title: Wrong accented characters in source files
data.body:
@victorlevasseur It seems that the sources are containing bad characters for accented characters (for example https://github.com/4ian/GD/blob/2593a9ef4d68cec81d1f336988fd3daceb37ad86/IDE/Credits.cpp#L223).

I think it was messed up during the refactoring to use gd::String. What should be the rationale for the encoding of the source files? Are we using UTF8?

data.title: Use C++11 random features instead of srand and rand
data.body:
Because it's better and the interval is really uniform (that's not the case with the modulo). It uses the system time (in C++11 way) as seed for the pseudo random engine (the seed can be generated by std::random_device if the computer has a undeterministic random device).

(see this nice talk : https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/GoingNative/2013/rand-Considered-Harmful)

EDIT : We can even provide other distributions (binomial, geometric, poisson, uniform **real**) with other expressions

data.title: Fix wxWidgets header included when not using wxWidgets in AdMobObject
Easy function to replace substring
Clarify the use of GPLv3 for the IDE
Clarify license of IDE.
data.body: It says it's released under the 'GNU General Public License' in the source headers and 'GPLv3' in the documentation. The source code needs to be updated to reflect this lest it can be taken as GPLv2 or GPLv1. It's also good to note if it's upgradable to the newest version.

data.title: gd::String interface improvement and FromCodePoint string expression for games
data.body:
This PR brings : 
- a new string expression to get a character from its codepoint (in native and JS games)
- a gd::String interface improved (replaced some char32_t by gd::String::value_type and replaced the typedef by the "using" type alias (C++11) )
- Travis CI uses GCC/G++ 5 to really support C++11. Don't know if the the version of clang is fully C++11 compliant... EDIT : Now uses GCC/G++ 4.8 since ba6a7b5

EDIT : The commit e70ff4e adds gd::String::UpperCase() and gd::String::LowerCase(). It also adds their equivalent as string expressions to use in native games and HTML5 ones.

data.title: Rename "Automatisms" to "Behaviors"
data.body:
I've made a global find/replace to change the word _automatism_ to _behavior_ which is much more appropriated and intuitive.
Everything should have been replaced, including extensions/actions/conditions names. When a project is loaded, a find/replace is made to update the actions/conditions names (for `ActivateBehavior` action and `BehaviorDisabled` condition) and the behavior type names.

@victorlevasseur I've tested with the examples and I think that everything should be working but maybe you can take a quick look?
Lots of files have been changed but hopefully this won't create too much conflict with your improved events editor and your PR for using size_t.
